name: Town Line Farm, LLC

name: African Alliance of Rhode Island (AARI)
address: Operates on Bami Farm, Johnston, RI (specific office address not provided in search results)
description: AARI runs Bami Farm, a community farm that grows produce. They are involved in community gardens, health and wellness programs, and cultural events. While not a cleanup service, they are a significant African-owned agricultural entity in Rhode Island
services: African-American-owned Farm cleanup in Rhode-Island consultation

name: Bami Farm
address: Johnston, RI (located at Snake Den Farm)
description: A 6-acre community farm run by the African Alliance of Rhode Island, where farmers grow a variety of produce. They are also involved in educational programs and farm tours
services: African-American-owned Farm cleanup in Rhode-Island consultation

name: Quaintly Farm
description: A Black Woman-Owned Urban Farm in Providence that grows local seasonal crops. They aim to offer urban farm stands for barter and sale within the community
